scenarioDescription:
The HD 220197 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 220197 is a star with 0.91 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located 210.08 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10.165 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 220197 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 220197 system


HD 220197 b

HD 220197 b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory, in 2019-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.73 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 220197 b is 63.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 220197 b is 9.320 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 220197 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 220197, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
name: HD 220197 - System With 1 Exoplanet
